definition[0]: if something averages out at a particular figure, it has that figure as an average over a period of time
example[0]: Training costs for last year averaged out at £5,100 per trainee.
example[1]: The government’s share of the cost was intended to average out at 25%.
definition[1]: to calculate the average of something
example[2]: I averaged out the total increase at about 10%.
definition[2]: to calculate the average of a number of amounts
example[3]: They were found to earn only £60 a week when their seasonal and casual earnings were averaged out.
definition[3]: if something averages out at a particular amount or rate, that is its average amount or rate
example[4]: Our training costs last year averaged out at £5,100 per trainee.
example[5]: Basketball players’ salaries average out at $3.3 million.
